definition: Xiongnu, a people of the Eastern Steppe who created an empire that flourished around the time of the Qin and Han dynasties
Hungary/Hungarian/abbr. for 匈牙利[Xiong1 ya2 li4]
old variant of 胸[xiong1]
slave

sentences.english: In other words, Liu's ancestors may be willing to belong to the Xiongnu tribe.
sentences.chinese: 也就是說，劉仁願的祖上有可能屬於匈奴族。

sentences.english: Hungarians have had the ambition of becoming the masters of the Central Plains for many years.
sentences.chinese: 北方的匈奴多年來一直有入主中原的野心。

sentences.english: Third, Huns have a 20% faster production bonus for their stables.
sentences.chinese: 第三，匈奴的馬房產馬速度較其它文明快20%。
我拿到了匈奴王的寶劍。

sentences.english: Chinese cavalry were of high quality, not much different from the Hunnish cavalry.
sentences.chinese: 中國騎兵部隊質量很高，和匈奴沒有什麼不同。

sentences.english: On the left there is your Attila the Hun.
sentences.chinese: 在你左邊的是匈奴大帝阿提拉。

sentences.english: The direct causation is the fighting for the Chanyu's heirdom.
sentences.chinese: 爭奪單于繼承權的鬥爭直接導致了匈奴的分裂。

sentences.english: The Hun kingdom was centered in modern-day Hungary.
sentences.chinese: 匈奴國以現今的匈牙利爲中心。

sentences.english: They trace their ancestry to King Xiutu of the Xiongnu.
sentences.chinese: 追溯到他們的祖先匈奴的休屠王。

sentences.english: The use of Uzbek language belongs to Altaic Turkic language branch, West Huns.
sentences.chinese: 使用烏孜別克語，屬阿爾泰語系突厥語族西匈奴語支。

sentences.english: The Goths are being driven into Roman territory by the Huns .
sentences.chinese: 哥特人是被匈奴人趕入羅馬境內的。

sentences.english: He thinks he's the reincarnation of attila the hun.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲他是匈奴王阿提拉的化身。

sentences.english: Chanyu means the chief of Xiongnu.
He was made a duke for his contribution in fighting against the Huns.
sentences.chinese: 在抗擊匈奴的戰爭中立功，他被授予王爺的位號。

sentences.english: The Huns would have easily taken over and killed us all.
sentences.chinese: 匈奴人可以輕易地打敗我們並且把我們全部殺死。

sentences.english: Attila the Hun decorated his battle helmet with the figure of one. —Mel White
sentences.chinese: 匈奴王阿提拉就以一隻蒼鷹形像裝飾他戰鬥的頭盔。

definition: Han Dynasty (206 BC-220 AD)
chanyu (Han Dynasty name for chiefs of Xiongnu Huns 匈奴[Xiong1 nu2])
Turkic ethnic group
Xianbei or Xianbi, group of northern nomadic peoples
Eastern barbarian/ancient ethnic group of northeast frontier of China
ancient people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
Tuyuhun, a Xianbei 鮮卑|鲜卑 nomadic people/a state in Qinhai in 4th-7th century AD
ethnic groups in the north and west of China in ancient times/foreigner/barbarian
Wusun kingdom of central Asia (c. 300 BC-300 AD)
Wuhuan (nomadic tribe)
the Greater Yuezhi, a branch of the Yuezhi 月氏[Yue4 zhi1] people of central Asia during the Han dynasty
Goguryeo (37 BC-668 AD), one of the Korean Three Kingdoms
Li Ling (-74 BC), Han dynasty general whose defeat by the Xiongnu 匈奴 in 104 BC led to a major scandal
Emperor Wu of the Han dynasty (141-87 BC)
the Xirong, an ancient ethnic group of Western China from the Zhou Dynasty onwards/Xionites (Central Asian nomads)
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
